name: KOTHIMBIR VADI
desc: Kothimbir vadi is a wonderful starter snack that is extremely popular among Maharashtrians and often prepared in most Maharashtrian homes served with steaming hot masala tea.
instructions:
In a mixing bowl, make a batter of besan flour adding little water and ensure that it is free of lumps. The batter should be thick of pouring consistency.
In a pan, heat little oil for tempering, add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, ajwain , crushed garlic, ginger and green chilies, saute it for few seconds.
Then add asafoetida (hing), turmeric powder, jeera powder, garam masala and mix well.
Now add besan batter stirring continuously until the batter become a thick paste without forming lumps (reduce the heat if necessary).
When the batter starts thickening, add salt, chopped coriander leaves, roasted peanut powder and mix well. Add little oil and keep mixing till it forms to a thick paste.
Grease a tray and pour this mixture into the tray and spread evenly (as shown in the video).
Cool this mixture and cut them into cubes or desired shapes.
Heat oil in a kadai for deep frying and when the oil is hot, fry the besan pieces until crispy and golden. Drain oil from the fritters and remove on paper towel.Serve this delicious snack with chutney or ketchup and hot masala tea.

name: German Cheese Cake
desc: How to makeGerman Cheese Cake?How to cookGerman Cheese Cake?Learn the recipeGerman Cheese Cakeby vahchef.For all recipes visit vahrehvah.com18410
instructions:
Precondition:Preheat oven at 180 degrees. Grease a baking tray and line it with baking paper.For the Base:Mix 1 Egg, 125 gram Butter, 125 gram Sugar, Vanilla Sugar, Baking Powder, All purpose flour, Semolina and a pinch of salt. Knead it into a smooth dough and refrigerate it.For the filling:Separate 4 egg whites and yolks. Beat the egg whites with a hand mixer till it reaches a creamy consistency and set aside. In another bowl, beat egg yolks with 150 gms sugar, lemon peel, Quark/ Cheese Curd, Sour cream, Vanilla Pudding and 40 gms Butter.
Mix egg whites with the other beaten mixture (Don't over mix). Now place the refrigerated base in the baking tray and flatten it uniformly with your hand. Pour the filling over it and bake it in the oven for 45 minutes.

name: BEET ROOT SOUP
desc: Borsh is a traditional Russian soup prepared from beets and cabbage. It is usually served with a spoon of sour cream. There are over 40 varieties of hot and cold borsh that use different combinations of vegetables and meats.
instructions:
Put a vessel on the stove heat it and add some chopped onions and garlic paste, add butter.
Once the butter is melting add chopped celery, chopped carrots, chopped tomatoes, tomato puree, cubes of potatoes and add full cup of beetroot then add vegetable stock.
Once it comes to boil, add salt and sugar, a cup of cabbage, pepper powder, dill leaves and red wine vinegar.
DUMPLING: Take one egg add 1/2 cup milk, a pinch of salt, caraway seeds, add Maida mixed with baking powder make a paste.
Take the paste in a spoon and drop the dumpling in the soup.
Once the soup is ready to transfer to another bowl and garnish with parsley, sour cream, and lemon.

name: CHICKEN CHOW MEIN
desc: One of the most popular recipes on Rasa Malaysia is Chow Mein or Chinese fried noodles.Chicken Chow Mein is a surprisingly simple, authentic Chinese dish.veggies and noodles tossed in the sauce which make this dish delicious.
instructions:
Take one bowl to season the chicken first add pepper, salt, soya sauce(one or two drops) Mix it and keep it aside.
In a chicken stock add salt, sugar, pepper powder, soya sauce, oyster sauce, bottle chilly sauce, vinegar and mix it up.
Heat the oil in a large saucepan and add chicken, when chicken is cooked, add chopped ginger garlic and green, red, yellow capsicum, carrot, cabbage, spring onions, and add sauce mixture.
All vegetables and chicken well cooked add noodles and toss them, switch off the flame.Now add spring onions and sesame seeds, serve it.

name: ACHARI CHICKEN
desc: Achari (sometimes known as achaar or achar) means pickle.  Basically, this is a chicken dish that is made with all the spices one would normally use in an Indian pickle.
instructions:
Heat oil in a heavy-based pan over medium heat add onions, salt, fry until golden brown.
Add ginger garlic paste, turmeric powder, tomatoes, red chilly powder, green chilies, and saute it they are well soft.
Now add yogurt mix and cover it, let it cook for 3 to 4 minutes on low heat.
Add chicken let it cook for 15 minutes then add mint.
Separately put a frying pan on the stove on medium heat add a mustard oil on this.
In this add few cumin seeds, mustard seeds, red chilies, fennel seeds, peppercorn, fenugreek seeds, crushed coriander seeds.
Tempering of achari to the chicken, then add chopped coriander, lemon juice, cook on very low heat for 5 minutes.

name: POTATO LEEK SOUP
desc: A smooth, creamy vegetable soup that's full of flavour. Make it into a meal with plenty of bread and butter.One of the simplest but most tasty soups of all.
instructions:
Heat oil in a pan add chopped garlic, chopped onion sauteed for some time.
Add chopped leeks add diced potatoes cook for some time.
Add stock and cook for 5 minutes, remove from the stove and blend it into a paste
Again pour the paste into the saucepan add some more stock,
Add salt and pepper powder bring it to the boiling, after removing from the stove add fresh cream, garnish with chives and serve it.

name: Baby Corn Cigars
desc: baby corn cigars is a crispy fried snack especially kids like this kind of food. Making a thin sheet of egg an flour and stuffing this marinate baby corn and cheese make it on special occasions surely everyone likes it.
instructions:
Make thin wrapper in a nonstick pan with corn flour, refined flour, egg, water make.
Blanch a baby corn and slit them Make a stuffing with cheese, chat masala, chopped coriander, garam masala, jeera powder, Stuff these mixtures into the baby corn.
Place the stuffed baby corn on the sheet and roll it into the Cigar shape.
Deep fry them till golden brown colour.Serve it with chilly garlic sauce.

name: KALLU COMPOUND CHICKEN
desc: this kind of dish is made only in local toddy compounds because its spiciness will suit very well with people who have a toddy.
instructions:
Clean chicken, cut into small size pieces.
In a hot pan pour some oil, add finely chopped onions, salt, ginger, garlic, turmeric powder, green chilies, and curry leaves, cook it for some time.
Now add chicken pieces, sprinkle red chilly powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, and add garam masala powder, cover the lid, cook it for 10 minutes on a slow flame.
After 10 minutes turn the chicken upside down and cover the lid cook it for another 10 minutes on a slow flame.
Now add toddy, saute for some more time stirring occasionally till the chicken pieces are cooked.
Finish it off with finely chopped coriander.

name: Fish with  mild  coconut curry sauce
desc: Fish coated with spices and grilled until done and served with a mildly spiced gravy made of coconut and spices.
instructions:
Marinate fish with cumin powder, chilli powder,salt,lemon juice,turmeric powder, coriander powder, little oil and keep it aside for some time.
Then place the fish on non stick tawa or grilll till it cooked. Cook it on low flame.SAUCE:Heat oil, add chopped onion, salt and saute it for 1 minute.
Now add chopped garlic,  green chilli saute for sometime. Then add pinch of turmeric powder, cumin powder, grated coconut, coconut milk and bring it to boil.
Then add crushed pepper, mix and switch off the flame.
Add chopped sprng onion and coriander leaves.
Take the grilled fish in to the plate and pour the coconut sauce on top.Serve hot with rice or roti.

name: Mango and red onion salsa
desc: Summer Salsa is a fantastic sweet, sour and tangy dipping made with crush ripe mangoes and pestle flavoured with cumin seeds, coriander leaves and onion.

name: Murg Dahi Dhania Korma
desc: Murgh as known as the chicken is a delicious dish with the spices of coriander cooked in curd gravy.
instructions:
Boil the water in a deep pan, add the chicken and whole spices bring the water to a boil again, blanch for 2-3 minutes and keep it aside.
In a pan add the pure ghee, onion puree, garlic and add the slurry of mixed spice powders into it and add beaten yogurt, mix well and cook until the ghee separates from the mixture.
Add the chicken pieces and add just enough chicken boil water so that when the meat is tender, very little water remains.
Sprinkle the saffron and stir.Serve hot, garnished with lots of coriander leaves.

name: Eggs in Spicy Chettinad Masala
desc: Eggs in Spicy Chettinad Masala is an exotic dish made with some freshly roasted aromatic spices, shallots cooked in a spicy gravy, fried egg dunked in and cooked for few minutes.
instructions:
Take a pan, add red chilies, pepper corns, whole garam masala spices (dry red chilies, pepper corns, kapok buds, star anise, lichen, cardamom, maize,  cinnamon stick), coriander seeds, fennel seeds, poppy seeds, and all dry roast them, and make it a powder.
Take boiled eggs and roast it for about 1-2 minutes in oil then season it with red chili powder.
Heat oil in another pan, add mustard seeds, when mustard seeds sizzle.
Then add cumin seeds, shallot paste, and saute it till onions are slightly golden in color.
In the same pan, add curry leaves, turmeric powder, ginger garlic paste, cook it for some time.
Later, add green chilies, coconut powder,  tomato puree, chili powder,  cook with closed lid for 5 minutes on a slow flame,
Add salt and chettinad masala along with water mix it and cook for some time.
At last, add fried eggs and chopped coriander leaves and switched off the flame.Serve this hot with naan, chapattis, and rice.

name: CHICKEN TARIWALA RECIPE
desc: This is a classic Punjabi recipe, and I have seen many Punjabi ladies make this recipe to perfection. The key to this recipe is Coriander powder, which is used heavily and hence, its flavor.
instructions:
Heat oil in a pan add chopped coriander leaves, ginger garlic paste, onion paste, and turmeric powder till this cook lightly golden colour.
 Add coriander powder, cumin powder, red chilly powder, add beaten yogurt and mix it up, add coriander steam, and add chicken, salt, water, cook for 20 minutes on a slow flame.
Add garam masala, tomatoes and let it cook for further 5 minutes, and switch off the flame.Serve this hot with rice, chapattis.

name: CELERY BASMATHI PULAO
desc: The combination of this two main ingrediants celery and basmati rice will gives an attractive aroma to the dish when you cooked. this dish is not only a delicious but also healthy.
instructions:
Heat butter in a pan, add fennel seeds, saute it,
Then add chopped celery stems, salt, and saute them again for about a minute.
Add celery leaves paste, chopped green chilies, cook it for another 2 minutes.
Then even add vegetable stock (or) chicken stock, once the water comes to boil. Put basmati rice (soaked for 30 minutes) and let it cook with closed lid for 3 minutes.
Take another pan heat ghee, add slices of garlic and slices of almonds, saute them.
Then top it with garlic and almonds, fried onions, and saffron water, and mix it properly with rice.Serve this hot.

name: CHEESE PEARLS PULAO
desc: This pulao is a visual delight with lightly browned cashew nuts. Moti pulao is truly a delightful rice recipe with authentic Indian flavours. and the motis which means pearls which made from paneer and khova gives a rich flavour to this pulao.
instructions:
Grate the cottage cheese add corn flour and cardamom powder, salt mix it and make a dough.
In another bowl add khoya, tutty fruity, mix it and make this also like a dough, stuff the khoya mixture in the cottage cheese mixture.
Fry these dumplings in hot oil, coat the paneer balls with silver foil and keep it aside.
Heat ghee in a pan add cinnamon, cardamom, shahi jeera, bay leaf, cloves, and cashew nut(soaked in water) add green chillies, chopped coriander, chopped mint, sugar, add water, and boil them.
In this add the basmati rice (soaked in the water at least 30 minutes) after 3 minutes mix it again, and add fried onions, saffron mixed milk, and milk mix it, put the lid on for 3to 4 minutes.
Transfer the rice to a plate and garnish with silver foil coated paneer balls on the top of the rice, sprinkle fried onions, and serve it.

name: STEAMED FISH
desc: This is one way took fish cooking in a healthy way. You can always opt to use fish fillet instead because no matter what, I can assure you that it will be delicious.
instructions:
Take your choice of fish and give gashes on both sides.
Then stuff lemongrass, ginger pieces in the middle of fish, raw mango pieces put in the gashes. Steam the fish for 4 to 5 minutes.Make a sauce :In a bowl, add lemon juice, sugar, soya sauce, fish sauce, and chopped spring onion.
After steaming fish, add Julliene of yellow zucchini, cucumber, carrot, cover and cook it further till done after 10-12 minutes, take the fish and put it on a plate.
Take the juices of steamed fish, pour it on the sauce, mix it and pour the sauce on the top of the fish.Steamed fish is ready to serve with some blanched green leafy vegetables.

name: Chicken Biryani Restaurant Style
desc: This kind Chicken Biryani is restaurant style of biryani they won't do dum process they cook the chicken separately with same masalas which we use for chicken biryani and rice will be cooked separately if the order comes they mix rice and chicken together and serve because the same rice can also use for vegetarians.
instructions:
First, make a powder of all the spices.
In a bowl add chicken pieces and add made masala, chili powder, ginger garlic paste, turmeric powder, salt, coriander powder, curd, chopped mint leaves, coriander leaves, green chilies, lime juice, oil, mix it well, and put it in the refrigerator overnight.
Heat water in a vessel and let it come to a boil add oil, salt, shahi jeera, bay leaf.
Once it comes to boil, add basmati rice (soak the rice for 1 hour) cook the rice till 75 % done.
Then in another pan, add a layer of marinated chicken and add this layer of rice.
Sprinkle fried onions, and add dissolved saffron strands in milk, then add ghee (optional), kewra water, rose water and put the lid on which is lined with sticky dough for dum.
First, cook it on high for first 4-5 minutes then reduce the flame to low, use a griddle under this for even heat transfer. And cook it for 25 to 30 minutes and switch off the flame.
After 40 minutes this is ready for open the seal of the lid. Never mix the biryani just check it removing the top rice and checking the bottom of the vessel for burnt marks.

name: Apples Walnut Caramel Crunch
desc: The perfect recipe for an abundant apple season. After one taste, youll want to make it again and again.
instructions:
Take a bowl, add cinnamon powder, corn flour, all purpose flour, pinch of salt, baking powder, mix it well.
Remove the apple skin, cut them in to wedges, then put the apple wedges into the batter, and deep fry them in hot oil.
For caramel: Heat a pan, add sugar, make a light caramel on medium flame and drop the deep fried apple wedges.
Drop this caramelized apple in the ice bath, shock and take it out,
Take the walnut nuts, caramelize it in the rest of the caramel mixture. Later, crush the walnut with a rolling pin.Serve it with caramelized apple wedges with scoop of your favorite ice cream.

name: Corn Spinach Cheese Toast
desc: Corn Spinach Cheese Toast, a toast using corn and spinach is an excellent snack
instructions:
Heat butter in a pan,  add chopped garlic, chopped onions, nutmeg, salt, all-purpose flour, cook till raw flavor is gone.
To it, add corn, reduce the flame then add cold milk, mix it until smooth consistency.
Later, add spinach to it, cook it and switch off the flame.
Take spinach and corn mixture spread it on bread, grate some cheese on top, and sprinkle the chilli flakes.
Put the bread toast in the oven cook till the cheese is melts.
Serve this with favorite sauce.

name: Tangy Curry Kata Meeta Daal
desc: An innovative dal for those who like to experiment with the magic of flavours ! Rich in iron and fiber this dal is also a healthy treat. Radish adds its distinct flavour, while roasted beaten rice and coconut add a mild but interesting flavour and texture.
instructions:
Soak garbanzo, green peas, and green gram for over night and boil them.
Heat oil in a pan, add fenugreek seeds, crushed garlic, kalonji, chopped onions, curry leaves, salt, turmeric and saute it.
Then add boiled garbanzo, green peas, green moong, and cook it for some time.
In this oil, add chili powder, garam masala powder, chopped tomato, jaggery, after sometime of sauting even add tamarind juice, cook this till moisture is evaporate.Serve this with chapatti, naan.

name: Dal Makhani with Masoor Dal
desc: Dal Makhani a Punjabi lentil preparation with split black urad dal. A delicious creamy dal recipe, dal makhani or ma ki dal is favorite amongst all.
instructions:
First boil the dal with skin on till it gets to a soft and mash consistency.
Heat ghee in a pan, add cumin seeds, juliennes of ginger and garlic, chopped onion, once this lightly sauteed.
Add green chillies, red chili paste, chopped tomatoes, salt, and cook it with closed lid for 10 minutes on a slow flame.
In the same pan, add water and cooked lentil, even add butter and cook this dal on a slow flame for about 15 minutes.
At last, add cream (optional) to the same pan and cook for another 10 minutes. Serve this hot with chapatti.

name: Restaurant Biryani Gravy Onion Salan
desc: Onion Salan or the restaurant biryani gravy onion salan is commonly known as Hyderabadi Biryani sauce or salan.
instructions:
Heat a pan and dry roast the peanuts, sesame seeds, desiccated coconut, in this add chopped onion, cook this till onions are tender, put the ingredients in the blender and make a fine paste.
Heat oil in a pan, add onions, salt, saute them, and keep it aside.
In the same oil, add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, ginger garlic paste, curry leaves, chilly powder, coriander powder, turmeric, cumin powder along with peanuts, sesame seed paste, mix it and add water once comes to boil, put the flame slow for 15 minutes.
Then add tamarind juice, salt, jaggery, mix it and cook it with closed lid for some time.
In this add saute onions, cook for 12 minutes and switch off the flame.

name: Breakfast Egg Potato Bread Upma
desc: The Bread Upma Recipe is a delicious blend of potatoes and eggs combined.
instructions:
Heat white butter in a pan add cumin seeds, ginger garlic chopped, raw potatoes (cut into small pieces), salt, turmeric powder, chilly powder, chopped onions, let it cook for 2 minutes.
Add green chilly, mushrooms, eggs, chopped tomatoes, chopped coriander, bread powder, sprinkle water, mix it well, put the lid on cook for 2 minutes and switch off the flame.

name: Curry powder
desc: Curry powder is a spice mix of widely varying composition based on South Asian cuisine.
instructions:
Dry roast all ingredients and add fried onions and fried garlic, turmeric powder.
Put it in the blender and make a powder.

name: Talikala Paayasam
desc: Talikala payasam is traditional recipe made especially on Ganesh festival .
instructions:
Take a bowl, add around half cup of jaggery and water, mix it till this is dissolve.
Then add whole wheat flour, mix like a dough. Divide the dough into small portions and convert them into noodles shape, keep it aside.
Heat water in a pan, add jaggery, crushed fennel seeds. When jaggery dissolves, add hand made noodles.
When it comes to a boil, reduce the flame and cook on a slow flame for 10 minutes.
Now, fry the cashew nuts and almond in a hot ghee till they turn to light brown in color.
In the noodles, add cardamom powder,  coconut powder, cashew nuts, and almonds, even add rice flour for thickening and put the lid on for 1 minutes then switch off the flame.

name: Vegetable Shashlik
desc: Vegetable Shashlik Stick - Shashlik is originally a Russian dish.  Paneer Shashlik is one of the famous Indian starter made with paneer and several vegetables.
instructions:
Take a bowl, add sugar, vinegar, pepper powder, soya sauce, thyme, salt, curry powder, oyster sauce, tomato ketchup, olive oil, take a whisk and mix it.
In this, add onions, bell pepper (red, yellow, green), zucchini, paneer, tomatoes, mix it and rest for 1 hour.
Take a skewer, skew all vegetable in order and put it on hot griddle. Later pour the marinade mixture on the vegetables and cook it with closed lid on all sides on slow flame.
Take a pan, add the left over the mixture, add tomatoes, chili paste, cook it for 2 minutes to make accompanying sauce.
For the mango rice: Heat oil in a pan, add crushed ginger, salt and mango pulp, green chilies, saute it.
Then add cooked basmati rice and toss them.Serve this shasahlik on bed of mango tossed rice with the accompanying sauce.

name: Chicken Katsu Curry
desc: Katsu is a Japanese method of breadcrumbing chicken this version is served with a rich curry sauce.
instructions:
First, take a chicken breast in this add buttermilk, salt put it in the refrigerator for overnight.
Take some flour season with pepper powder and salt, coat the chicken breast in flour, shaking off any excess, dip them into the egg, and then press into the breadcrumbs until well coated on both sides, and deep fry them.
Make the sauce: Heat a pan add garlic and butter, add onion paste, 1/2 teaspoon flour, mix it cook it for some time.
Now add curry powder, soya sauce, honey, chicken stock, mix it well cook it for a minute.
Cut the chicken into pieces and pour sauce over the fried chicken.  Serve this with rice.

name: Fried Chicken Biryani
desc: This biryani is slightly different from the usual method, the chicken is first fried and then added to the masala. This is the easiest of all Biryanis - Andhra style kodi vepudu biryani
instructions:
In a bowl, add chicken, turmeric, ginger garlic paste, salt, chilly powder, garam masala powder, mix it and keep it aside for 30 minutes.
Then deep fry them for 160 c to 170 c till 70% cooked.
Heat oil in a pan add whole garam masala, chopped onion, cook this till onions are golden in color, even add turmeric powder, salt, tomatoes, cook this till tomatoes are soft.
Add chili powder, coriander powder, green chilies, curd, chopped mint and coriander, salt and add water, in this add fried chicken, lemon juice, garam masala powder and add basmati rice (soak in the water for 30 minutes and 70% cooked).
Then add fried onions, saffron color on top of it.
 Cover the pan with dough and close it with its lid, place the pan on tava on high flame for 5 minutes, after that cook it on a slow flame for 15 more minutes.Serve this hot.

name: Coconut cookies
desc: Coconut Cookies are loaded with coconut powder and sugar which give them a perfect chewy and  delicious taste.
instructions:
Take a bowl, add desiccated coconut and sugar powder and mix well. keep aside.
In a bowl, add butter (at room temperature) and cream it.
Then add powdered sugar, vanilla essence, egg to the above mixture and mix well.
In it, add desiccated coconut powder and whisk it again. Now, let it rest in refrigerator for about 15 minutes.Then divide into small portions and roll them like rotis .
Sprinkle the above prepared coconut and sugar mixture on top of it and  roll it again.
Later cut it into even sizes, and arrange the cookies in tray.  Now, bake it for about 15 minutes at 180 degree centigrades  and serve it.

name: Gun Powder for Idli Dosa Tava Fry
desc: Gunpowder or Milaga podi is made with a perfect blend of spices using the red chilies, urad dal, chana dal, hing or asafoetida, black pepper and little rice.
instructions:
Heat a pan add whole red chilly, peppercorns, chana dal, urad dal, roast this for 4 - 5 minutes in a slow flame.
Now add roasted chana dal, rice, sesame seeds, roast for another 4-5  minutes this till rice will change color.
Add curry leaves, hing, salt, desiccated coconut powder, dry roast all the ingredients and switch off the flame and put it in the blender and make a powder.Serve this with idly and dosa.

name: Tava Idli on Foodies Day Out
desc: A spicy recipe made by using leftover idlis, it is a great combination made with onions, tomatoes, and masalas.
instructions:
Heat tawa and add butter when butter melts add gunpowder, mix it and add chopped onions, chopped coriander leaves, cook it for a minute.
Add idly on top of this, cook it on both sides with masala, and switch off the flame.Serve this with coconut chutney.

name: Eggless Nan Khatai Cookies
desc: Eggless nan khatai Cookies are buttery soft melt in the mouth Indian cookies. Goes great with a cup of chai or just as a snack.

name: Jam Filled Butter Cookies
desc: Small dollops of fruit jam add an extra touch of sweetness to these moreish French butter cookies.
instructions:
Take a bowl, add butter, cream it, in this add powder sugar, mix it well.
Now add vanilla extract along with 1 tablespoon of water, again mix it. Later, add all purpose flour, knead it like a dough,
Take the dough, sprinkle with flour on top of floor, roll this dough into sheets, then take a fancy cutter and cut even number of the cookies into similar size.
After cookies are transfered in tray, leave half of the cookies just like that and to the rest of the cookie make a well in the center of each cookie using a smaller cutter.
Bake both of them at 180 degree centigrade for 15 minutes.
Now, take jam, with palate knife cream it.
At last, to serve it take the hallow one  put in on the flat once,  fill the hole with your favorite jam. Put it in the oven for 1 more minute and remove them.Delicious Jam Filled Butter Cookies is now ready to serve.

name: Veggie Momos Perogies
desc: Veggie momos perogies, are steamed dumplings, which makes everyone crave for more!!
instructions:
In a bowl add all-purpose flour, salt, sour cream, sprinkle water make this into a soft dough, knead the dough for 5 minutes, cover it and rest it for 20 minutes.
Take another bowl add boiled and mashed potato, salt, grated cheese, butter, pepper, chopped parsley and mix it well.
Take the dough, using rolling pin, roll a big thin sheet
Cut them into a small disc using a cutter and stuff with the potato mixture, grated cabbage.
Apply water on edges, fold half and seal the edges by pinching them together.
Boil salted water in a large pot. Drop perogies in boiling water and cook for 7 to 8 minutes until they start floating.
Take a pan add olive oil, heat it and add a slice of onions, salt, pepper,  mix herb and saute it well.
After that add boiled perogies, toss them slowly.Serve Veggie Momos Perogies hot.

name: Pot Chicken Rice Oriental Biryani
desc: Claypot chicken rice is popular in many Asian countries. A simple recipe to make Chicken Biryani using a slow electric cooker or a crock pot.
instructions:
Heat oil in a clay pot, add a slice of garlic, ginger, green chilies, saute it slightly, then add chicken pieces, light Soya sauce, dark Soya sauce, oyster sauce, cook this for few more minutes.
Then add mushrooms, roundels of carrot, onion diced, saute it.
In the same pan, even add salt, chicken stock, once come to boil, add rice (soak the rice for 30 minutes), mix it well, put the lid on let it cook for 10 minutes, (you can cook this in the oven at 200 c for 20 to 30 minutes) once mix the rice then cook this on a slow flame for 1 more minute.
Switch off the flame and rest it for 10 minutes and then serve it.

name: Masala Dal with Onion Tomato Gravy
desc: This masala dal clubbed with toor dal, onion, tomato, veggies like ridge gourd all together is a tasty dish to have with plain rice.
instructions:
Heat oil in a pressure cooker add onions, salt, saute acute; it and add ginger garlic paste, tomatoes, turmeric powder, chilly powder, cumin powder, coriander powder, mix this and put the lid on and let it cook for 15 to 20 minutes in a slow flame (6 to 7 whistles),
Use this gravy in many veg and nonveg curries.
Heat oil in a pan add mustard seeds when mustard seeds splutter add cumin seeds, red chilly, curry leaves, saute acute; it and add ridge gourd, cook for few minutes.
Then add onion tomato gravy, add tamarind juice, salt, cook this and add boiled daal, put the lid on let it comes to boil, switch off the flame.Serve this hot with rice.

name: Dhanshak
desc: Dhansak is a popular Indian dish, especially among the Parsi Zoroastrian community. It combines elements of Persian and Gujarati cuisine. Dhansak is made by cooking mutton with a mixture of lentils and vegetables.
instructions:
For dry masala:Heat a pan, add red chilies, peppercorns, star anise, green cardamom, cloves, cumin seeds, dry roast along with Kasuri methi, make them into dry powder and keep it aside.For wet masala:
 Take another pan, add coriander seeds, peppercorns, cinnamon stick, star anise, green cardamom, cumin seeds, cloves, red chilies, fenugreek seeds, dry roast it and switch off the flame and add green chilies, chopped coriander, dill leaves, put these into the grinder along with some water and make a fine paste.Preparation:Heat oil in a pressure cooker,  add chana dal, toor dal, moong dal, masoor dal, roast all dals  then add pieces of pumpkin, eggplant, potato, tomato along with water and turmeric powder,  cook it with closed lid for 4 whistles.
Heat oil in another pressure cooker, add bay leaves, chopped onions, salt, cook it till onions are slightly transparent.
 In it, add ginger garlic paste, mutton pieces along with some water and cook it with closed lid for 3 to 4 whistles.
Heat a pan, add the cooked dals, mutton, also wet masala paste along with water (as required consistency).
At last, add tamarind juice, grated jaggery, ghee, mix it well and cook it for some more time.Serve it with brown rice.

name: Lemon Rice
desc: It is a tempting south Indian dish prepared by adding lemon juice while stir frying steamed rice in spices.
instructions:
Heat the oil in a pan, add red chilies, mustard seeds.
When mustard seeds splutter, add chana dal, black gram, cashew nuts saute it till the dals turn golden.
 Then add chopped ginger, curry leaves, hing, green chilies, turmeric powder, sugar, salt and lime juice to the tempering and mix it to the precooked boiled rice.
For additional flavor, sprinkle a half teaspoon of sugar, mix it well.

name: Chhena Poda
desc: Chhena poda is a cheese dessert from the state of Odisha in eastern India. Chhena poda literally means burnt cheese in Odia.
instructions:
Boil the milk in a heavy bottom pan on a medium heat, stir in between, as the milk boils, gradually add the lime juice and stir slowly.
You will notice that the milk gets curdled, turn off the heat.
Now strain the curdled milk through a muslin cloth.
Press the chhena to take out the water and transfer into a bowl.
Add semolina, sugar and some Chana water to it, mix it well.
Then add baking powder, ghee, cardamom powder, raisins, Pistachio, cashew nuts, mix it again.
Take baking tray grease it with ghee and pour the mixture into the mold, put it into the oven at 165 degree centigrade for 1 hour.
Let it cool down, take it out on a plate, cut into slices and serve.

name: Khoya Chicken
desc: It is a delicious North Indian style chicken cooked in an onion and tomato gravy and flavored with grated khoya for the last few minutes as a finish.
instructions:
Dry roast red chilies, when slightly roasted, saute it by adding coriander seeds, fennel seeds, kalonji (black cumin), then let it cool down, add some salt then crush it into a coarse powder.
Take a bowl, add chicken pieces then add prepared masala powder, yogurt, khoya, mix it well and marinate for about 1 hour.
Heat ghee in a pan, add cloves, cinnamon sticks, chopped onions, saute it.
Then add ginger garlic paste to the same pan and cook this till raw flavor is gone.
Add crushed garlic, saute it and add marinated chicken pieces, cook it for about 3 minutes then add some water, mix it and let it cook for 25 minutes on a slow flame with closed lid.Serve this with Naan and Chapathi.

name: Chicken Dosakaya
desc: Chicken Dosakaya is a classic dish with a unique taste. Dosakaya chicken curry is very tasty and easy chicken curry liked by all.
instructions:
Heat oil in a pan add mustard seeds and saute it.
When mustard seeds splutter, add cumin seeds, dry red chilies, curry leaves, saute it again for about half a minute.
To it, even add onion paste, salt and cook this until slightly change the color.
In the same pan,  add ginger garlic paste, turmeric powder, cook this till raw flavor is gone.
Now, season it with chili paste, coriander powder along with some water, mix it well.
Then add chicken pieces, yellow cucumber mix this and let it cook with closed lid for 25 to 30 minutes.
Finally add lemon juice, chopped coriander leaves.Serve with pulkas, naan, roti, and rice.

name: Recipe Contest - Be Fit Be Cool AAPI VahRehVah
desc: Recipe Contest - Be Fit Be Cool AAPI VahRehVah

name: Egg Dosa
desc: How to makeEgg Dosa?How to cookEgg Dosa?Learn the recipeEgg Dosaby vahchef.For all recipes visit vahrehvah.com
instructions:
Soak the urad dal for 2 hours and make fine paste of it
In a bowl add urad dal paste, rice flour, all-purpose flour, salt, baking powder. and by adding water make it like a dosa batter
To this add honey and mix well.
Now Heat the tawa and pour the batter and spread it like a dosa.
On the top of it put the egg and spread all the sides, and also add some oil.
To that add gunpowder, onions, green chilies, coriander leaves, tomatoes, korma.Fold it and Serve hot.

name: Chicken and Chips Recipe With Philips Airfryer by VahChef
desc: This is a veg and non-veg mixed snack prepared with chicken and potato.
instructions:
Firstly peel the potatoes and cut them into thin slices and soak them in water, keep aside.
Cut chicken into small pieces, to marinate the chicken, take a bowl and add in pepper powder, crushed garlic, red chili powder, soya sauce, a pinch of garam masala and some finely chopped coriander leaves.
Mix well to coat the chicken pieces with these spices, rest this for a while.
Soak wooden skewers in water for a while.
Take a slice of potato and place a chicken piece inside the slice and slowly slide in the skewer in between the potato and chicken piece.
Place four such pieces on one skewer, repeat the same until all are done.
Make batter for coating the potato and chicken pieces. Take a bowl and add in cornstarch, maida, a pinch of salt, turmeric powder, ginger garlic paste, red chili powder and little water, mix all ingredients to make a thick batter.
With help of a brush, coat the potato slices and chicken pieces with the batter on all side and keep aside.
Put 1 teaspoon of oil in the batter and mix well. Just before frying, coat the potato and chicken pieces again with this batter and keep aside. 
Preheat the air-fryer to 200 degrees centigrade for 5 minutes. Pull out the basket and place the skewers inside the tray and cook them at 200 degrees centigrade for 5-6 minutes.
For making the sauce, put in some vinegar, sugar, lemon juice, tomato ketchup, chili paste, garlic in the blender and blend well to make a fine paste.Serve the chips and chicken hot with sauce.

name: Cocktail Onion Samosa Recipe With Philips Airfryer by VahChef
desc: Cocktail samosa is the classic samosa recipe twisted to make a perfect accompaniment with drinks for a party.
instructions:
In the food processor using the option of dough mixer blade, add the all-purpose flour, little salt, ajwain and butter and mix to make a shortcrust kind of dough. Add little water and make into stiff dough.
For the stuffing, in a bowl, add some chopped onions, salt, red chili powder, chopped coriander leaves, chaat masala, poha, and grated paneer. Mix all the ingredients well.
Make lemon size balls out of the flour dough. Roll them into flat round small chapattis. Cut each chapatti into the half. Fold each piece to make cones.
Fill in the stuffing mixture and seal the edges using little water.
Preheat the air fryer to 180-degree centigrade for 5 minutes.
After 5 minutes, pull out the basket and arrange the samosa in the basket and cook for 170-degree centigrade for 4 minutes.
Pull out the basket and brush the samosa with little oil and cook for about 6-7 minutes at 160-degree centigrade.
Remove and serve hot with any sauce of your choice.

name: How to Make Crumb Fried Fish And Chips with Philips Airfryer by VahChef
desc: Fried fish and chips is an amazing and perfect dish that is not as hard as you might think to create your own fried fish at home with very less oil. This dish hardly
instructions:
In a plate, place the two fish fillet and season them with a little salt, pepper powder, mustard paste, lemon juice, chili flakes, beaten egg and spread the spices and coat the fillets on all sides.
In another plate, put some breadcrumbs and add oil, mix well.
Take the fish fillet and coat it with the bread crumbs nicely on all sides.
Preheat the Phillip air fryer for 5 minutes at 200 degrees C.
Pull out the basket and place the fish fillets and over that add in the thinly sliced potato and air fry for 7 minutes.
After 7 minutes, turn the fish upside down and fry again for about 3-4 minutes.
Remove and serve hot.

name: INDIAN SORREL PULIODHRAI
desc: Gongura Pulihora is an easy Indian food recipe that is popular in Andhra. Gongura is highly rich in vitamins, iron, and antioxidants. Prepared a rice dish on the lines of tamarind rice and use sorrel leaves as the main ingredient to provide the tart flavor.
instructions:
In a hot pan add chana dal, 3 dry red chilies, mustard seeds, coriander seeds, fenugreek seeds, sesame seeds and roast them till they get a nice color, then make it into a powder.
In a pan heat oil add hing, curry leaves, sorrel leaves and cook for 2-3 minutes and add this mixture to powder and make it into a paste.
In another pan heat till oil, add 4 dry red chilies, ½ teaspoon urad dal, peanuts and fry them, to that add turmeric powder, sorrel leaves paste, tamarind juice, salt and cook for 2-3 minutes.
Now add this mixture to rice, mix well and serve.

name: FATTA FAT CHUTNEY - GUAVA CHUTNEY
desc: Amrood Ki Chutney is a traditional dish from the Indian cuisine prepare from a classic fresh guava This sweet-tangy tasted chutney can be served with any  snack. It is easy to prepare, time saving and nutritious with lots of fibers.
instructions:
Cut the guava into small pieces along with seeds and keep it aside.
In a bowl, add red chilli powder, mustard powder, pinch of turmeric powder, fenugreek powder, salt and guava pieces, lemon juice and mix all together.
Heat oil for tempering, add mustard seeds when mustard seeds splutter then add cumin seeds, red chilies, urad dal (optional) and pinch of asafoetida.
pour this tempering on the top of the guava chutney and mix it well.
Let it sit for 2 to 3 hours and serve it.

name: DRUMSTICK LEAF DRY CURRY
desc: Drumstick Leaves Dry Curry is a delicious Indian recipe served with rice or roti.

name: RAW PAPAYA CURRY
desc: Green papaya has a very mild, almost bland taste, but it is the medium through which robust flavor ingredients take body and form. Raw papaya curry is an indian style that would make a fantastic vegetarian dish.
instructions:
In a hot pan, add peanuts, dry red chilies, and roast it.
Then add cumin seeds, sesame seeds, desiccated coconut and roast them they get a nice color then make it into a coarse powder.
In the same pan, heat oil, add mustard seeds and saute it.
When they crackle, add chana dal, chopped garlic, turmeric powder, curry leaves, green chilies, onions, salt, papaya pieces and cook for 2-3 minutes.
Now add prepared masala, toss it well.Serve with chapati or rice.

name: OATS CONGEE WITH PANEER
desc: Oat Congee with paneer is got subtle flavors from some of the best herbs and spices to make it taste good and light. Congee as popular known in Tamil Nadu is a rice porridge made with plain rice. It is most often served as side dishes.
instructions:
In a vessel, pour some water, add grated carrot, orange zest, fennel powder, pepper powder, juliennes of ginger, oats and salt to taste, allow this to boil.
After it comes to boil, reduce the flame add orange juice and let it simmer for 4 to 5 minutes. Switch off the flame.
Then add dill leaves and serve hot in a soup bowl by adding paneer slices.Delicious Oats Congee with Paneer is now ready to serve.

name: THOTAKURA PULUSU KURA
desc: Thotakura pulusu is an amazing dish that tastes tangy, spicy, sweet and a natural earthy flavor. Made of Thota kura also known as Amaranth leaves are very popularly cooked in most of the south Indian homes.
instructions:
In a pan heat oil add mustard seeds when they crackle add red chili, cumin seeds, chopped onions, curry leaves, salt, turmeric powder, mix it well.
Then add drumsticks and yellow Cucumber pieces, tomatoes cook for 2-3 minutes with the lid on.
Now add green chilly paste, chana dal (soaked in water) cook it another 3 minutes.
Now add tamarind juice along with water, mix it and check the seasoning, cook it for 2 minutes 
Add amaranthus leaves, sorrel leaves, chopped coriander leaves, mix it cook for 5 minutes.Serve with rice.

name: VEGGIE BUNNY CHOW
desc: veggi bun chow is a popular South African fast food dish, It is very easy and quick to prepare the veggi bun chop, It is consisting of a hollowed out loaf of bread filled with a spicy and appetizing curry.
instructions:
Take a bun and hollow out the center, reserve the top .
 In a hot pan, add half teaspoon of oil, chopped onions, salt and saute them.
To that add turmeric powder, ginger garlic paste, along with some water and cook for a minute.
Add chopped tomatoes, cumin powder, coriander powder, chili powder, garam masala and fry them for few minutes.
Now add some more water, chopped carrot, chopped potatoes, green peas, cauliflower florets, chopped beans, nuts paste and cook for 5-6 minutes till the vegetables are cooked.
Add sprouts and cook for another 1 minute.
Finally add chopped coriander and lime juice mix well.
Put this mixture in the middle of the bun and serve hot as is .

name: RADISH CHUTNEY 2
desc: Radish chutney is a very popular dish from the Kashmiri cuisine. This is one of the most refreshing ways to relish radish which is a simple yet appetizing Kashmiri vegetarian recipe. grated radish spiced with few green chillies and little red chilli powder, flavored with shahi jeera mixed with curd to make an awesome.
instructions:
Heat oil in a pan add radish pieces, garlic, green chilies, tamarind, cumin seeds, turmeric powder, and salt, saute it, then cover it with a lid and cook it for 5minutes.
Now switch off the flame then cool it and transfer into a mixie jar, to make a peste.
For tempering: Heat oil in a pan add cumin seeds, chana dal, urad dal, curry leaves, mix it.
Now tempering add into a radish chutney and serve it.

name: BEETROOT CHUTNEY 1
desc: Beet root is a part of the regular meal in the Southern Indian states, Tamil Nadu and Kerala. Beet roots are low in calories, high in fiber, Beetroot chutney is a colorful recipe made in South India and is served with rice, chapati, idly and dosai.

name: DAHI MURGH SHERVA
desc: Sherva is a liquidy gravy made out of meat juices, thickened with locally available ingredients, mugh dahi serva uses yogurt for giving mild sartage balance with red chilly powder.
instructions:
In a hot pan dry roast the poppy seeds and cashew nuts, let it cool down then make a paste in a blender by adding some water.
Heat oil in a pan add cloves, cardamom, cinnamon, bay leaf saute it and add chopped onions cook the onions till they are slightly golden in color.
In this add chopped tomatoes, turmeric powder, ginger garlic paste, cook the ginger garlic paste raw flavor is gone.
Add Kashmiri chili powder, cumin powder, coriander powder, yogurt and add prepared poppy seeds and cashew paste mix well put the lid on and let it cook for 5 minutes.
After 5 minutes add chicken pieces and potato pieces and add required water for sherva put the lid on and cook until chicken and potatoes tender.Serve it with rice.

name: BEETROOT AND SPINACH FRY
desc: Beetroot and spinach is a simple and delicious dish popularly made in the South Indian cuisine, served as a Side dish.

name: BENGAL GRAM SWEET - HYAGREEVA SWEET
desc: Hayagreeva - the horse faced God, Hayagriva is a sweet recipe from Udupi, sweet made with chana dal, jaggery, dry coconut, Hayagreeva is a delicious Indian recipe served as a Dessert.
instructions:
Heat water in a pan add soaked chana dal cook this till it is soft.
Once the chana dal is cooked, add milk, jaggery and cook it for some time. Dry roast the poppy seeds in a pan and add this into the chana dal mixture.
Once it comes to boil then add grated coconut cook this in a slow flame along with chana dal mixture.
Heat ghee in a pan add cashew nuts and while stirring add almond slices.
Let it fry for 1 minute then add raisins, once the raisins puff up, we add chana dal mixture on the top of the dry fruits and add cardamom powder mix it well, switch off the flame. Serve it hot.

name: Bun kebab
desc: Bun Kebab is a Pakistani sandwich, originating from Karachi. It is usually found in roadside stalls and in restaurants all across Karachi.

name: TIRANGA RAGADA PATTIE
desc: Tri colored naturally flavored with spinach, carrot, and paneer is a perfect snack for celebrating Indians special days.
instructions:
Soak the three types of dried dals overnight. Drain the water and boil till it is soft and keep it aside.
Heat oil in a pan add onion paste, salt cook this few minutes, then add ginger garlic paste, green chili, turmeric cook for 2 minutes.
Then add chili powder, cumin powder, coriander powder, pepper powder, garam masala and add three types of dals (boiled) add some water and mix it well.
In this, add mint chutney mix it and add more water if too thick.
And add tomato puree put the lid on and let it cook for some time.
In a bowl add boiled and mashed potatoes, chat masala, salt mix it well, divide this mixture into three equal portions.
One portion mix it with boiled carrot mixture, second portion mix it with boiled spinach mixture, third portion mix it with grated paneer mix all the three portions separately, then make roundels.
Flatten the three color roundels and place the patties one above the other in the sequence of our National flag.
Heat oil in a tawa and place the tiranga patties cook it on both sides in a slow flame till it is nicely cooked.
Take the cooked pattie on a plate and cut in half and pour the ragada mixture on the top and garnish with chopped onions, mint chutney, curd, sweet chutney, chili powder, chaat masala, lime juice, chopped coriander and sev, serve it.

name: TAMARIND CHUTNEY
desc: Tamarind chutney is a south Indian chutney, made with tamarind, jaggery, green chilly, serve with roti or hot rice with ghee.
instructions:
In a blender add tamarind (soaked in water), cumin seeds powder, fenugreek seeds powder, jaggery, garlic, salt.
Heat oil in a pan add peanuts, cumin seeds when peanuts are slightly colored add green chili, curry leaves, mint leaves saute it for 2 minutes then transfer this to a blender and make it into a paste.
For tempering heat oil in a pan add mustard seeds when they splutter add cumin seeds, chana dal, dry red chilies, urad dal when the dals cooked add hing curry leaves, switch off the flame.
Pour this tempering of Oil, Mustard seeds, chana dal, red chili, Urad dal, asafoetida, curry leaves on the top of the tamarind chutney and add chopped onions(optional) mix it well.Serve this with chapati or rice.

name: AMARANTHUS POTATOES
desc: Potatoes get enriched with combination of Amaranthus greens and potatoes to make a delicious dish
instructions:
Heat oil in a pan add mustard seeds, dry red chili when mustard seeds splutter add cumin seeds, chopped garlic, chopped ginger, onion slices, salt, turmeric powder saute it for a minute then add chopped green chili, boiled potato pieces, coriander powder, cumin powder toss it.
Now add amaranthus leaves, sorrel leaves cook for 5 minutes.Serve this with chapati or rice.

name: DAL SULTANI 1
desc: A very rich and nice dal preparation Sultani dal, Mughlai influenced simple tadka dal with extra flavors of smoky pan leaf and charcoal.Specially served for Kings.
instructions:
First, boil the tour dal and keep it aside. Heat butter and ghee in a pan add cloves, cardamom, cumin seeds when cumin seeds splutter and add chopped garlic, saute it then add chopped onions, salt, turmeric, green chili saute it for few minutes.
Then add boiled tour dal, once the dal is cooked add milk, beaten yogurt put the lid on and let it comes to boil.
Adjust the seasoning and add sugar, saffron water, cream, chopped spring onions. 
In a steel bowl put the betel leaf and put this bowl on top of dal, and a small piece of charcoal on it, sprinkle garam masala powder while smoking pour 1 teaspoon of ghee on it and immediately cover it and switch off the flame and keep for ten minutes.
Remove the steel bowl and mix the dal once.Serve it with rice.

name: Chicken Hush Puppies
desc: Chicken Hush Puppies are awesome, simple, no-fuss, guilt-free, air fried snacks made with a concoction of cornmeal, flour, baking powder, baking soda combined with butter, chicken, spices, milk, garlic, and sugar. Then made into roundel shapes dumplings are brilliantly fried to make them amazingly crunchy on the outside and moist inside.
instructions:
In a bowl, add cornmeal flour, all-purpose flour, baking powder, baking soda and a little salt and mix all these ingredients and keep aside.
Heat 1 teaspoon of butter in a pan, when it melts, add chicken pieces, chopped garlic, onion, crushed pepper, coriander leaves and mix well.
Add water, milk, combine all ingredients together and allow it to boil.
Then add salt (to taste) and little sugar and mix well.
Once it starts boiling, switch off the flame and add the above-prepared flour mixture, mix to make the dough.
Shift this mixture into a big bowl, add beaten eggs and whisk again.
Dust some flour in your fingers and shape them into slightly big dumplings and keep aside.
Then with the help of a brush, coat the dumplings with 1 teaspoon of oil.
Preheat the Philips Airfryer at 180 degrees C for 3 minutes.
Open the basket and drop in the Hush Puppies and air fry for 7 to 8 minutes at 180-degree centigrade.Serve it hot with any sauce of your choice.

name: KACHA PACHHA MOONG DAL
desc: Green gram crushed and tossed with onions and Indian spices and  very well for diet cooking, goes very well with pulkas
instructions:
In a blender add Garlic, green chili, coriander and add some water to make a coarse paste.
Heat oil in a pan add chopped onions, salt saute it till onions slightly change the color.
Add turmeric powder, curry leaves and prepared chili, garlic and coriander leaves paste cook this for few minutes.
Add soaked moong dal (moon dal soaked in water for 2 hours) and add required water mix it well and put the lid on and let it cook till moong dal soft.
Add coriander powder, lemon juice mix it well and switch off the flame and put the lid on let it rest for 5 minutes.Serve it with chapati, pulka, and rice.

name: Dil Shahi
desc: Dil Shahi is made combining very few ingredients, stuffed with rich khoya, cardamom flavoured and tossed in sugar syrup to give an amazing glazy appearance.
instructions:
In a mixing bowl, add flour, cooking soda, ghee and crumble the ingredients.
To it, add beaten curd and mix to make stiff dough.
With help of rolling pin, roll the dough flat.
Spread khoya and sprinkle some cardamom powder, fold the dough and seal it. Roll and cut them into pieces.
Preheat the Philips airfryer at 180 degree centigrade for 3 minutes.
Open the basket, drop the Dil shahi pieces and air fry them for 7-8 minutes at 180 degree centigrade or until golden in color.
Once done, remove and drop them in single string hot sugar syrup.
After about 10 minutes of soaking, remove and serve them.

name: STEAMED CABBAGE CHUTNEY
desc: cabbage steamed is a perfection and made into a chutney.
instructions:
In a steamer add green chilies, coriander leaves, garlic, cabbage put the lid on and let it steam for 8-10 minutes.
Transfer this into a blender and add coconut paste, salt, lime juice, ginger make it into a coarse paste.
In this add sugar, roasted sesame seeds mix it well.Serve with roti, naan or rice.

name: MINT PEPPER CHICKEN 2
desc: Highly flavored chicken recipe with pepper and mint goes well in winter season,
instructions:
Heat oil in a pan and add chicken pieces, salt, sprinkle garam masala powder, yogurt mix it and put the lid on and let it cook for 15 minutes.
After 12 minutes remove the lid and let it cook till moisture evaporates. Transfer this pan to another side of the stove.
Heat a pan and add dry pudina, roast it for 2 minutes then transfer this to a bowl.
In the same pan heat oil and add ginger garlic paste, salt cook till raw flavor is gone then add red chilies, saute it and add fried chicken, crushed pepper powder, green chilies, pudina powder and toss it.Serve with rotis.

name: THUKPA
desc: Thukpa is a popular soup in the northern Himalayan region of Nepal, Ladakhi Chicken Thukpa Recipe, How to make Chicken Thukpa,
instructions:
Heat oil in a pan add chopped garlic, onion slices saute it for a minute then add small pieces of chicken cook it for 2 minutes add turmeric powder (optional) cabbage, carrot, juliennes of green chili, capsicum mix it well.
Add soya sauce, MSG, red chili powder, salt, green chili sauce, chicken stock and squeeze in ½ lemon, season to taste and add chopped coriander, spring onions and also add one egg cook this for 2 minutes.
In a plate add some boiled noodles, chopped spring onions, coriander leaves, and pour soup on the top of the noodles.Serve it hot.

name: SNAKE GOURD CURD CURRY
desc: It conisits of curd and South Indian style simple tempering. It is a kind of curd and snake gourd salad with tempering. Snakegourd is sauteed in a seasoning of curry leaves, green chillies, ginger and mustard seeds before combining with beaten curd
instructions:
Heat mustard oil in a pan till smoking hot, then add mustard seeds,  reduce the flame.
To it, add red chilies, cumin seeds to the same pan and saute it.
When they splutter, add chopped green chilies, curry leaves, turmeric powder, salt and mix well.
Then add chopped snake gourd to it, and cook it with closed lid till they are slightly tender.
In the same pan, add bitten curd, mix and switch off the flame.
At last, garnish with chopped coriander leaves and serve this with plain rice or sambar rice.

name: KASTHA ACHARI PANEER
desc: Its a delicious recipe, which is made up of pickle flavored paneer along with the batter and deep fried.

name: Sukha Palak Gosht
desc: Sukha palak gosht is a very popular dish and almost known in every part of the Indian Subcontinent. Palak Gosht means Spinach Mutton, is a delicious blending of tender succulent pieces of mutton cooked in spinach gravy.
instructions:
Heat oil in a pressure cooker, add shahi jeera, Peppercorns, sliced onions and add salt cook this till it is slightly colored.
In this add Mutton pieces, ginger garlic paste and roast this for 5 minutes then add Coriander powder, red chili powder mix well and cook it for some time.
Then add sliced tomato and water and put the lid on and cook it for 3 to 4 vessels till it meat is tender.
Fry the chopped spinach in a hot oil and keep aside.
Transfer the meat into a pan then add chopped garlic, nutmeg powder, garam masala and add deep fried spinach mix well and cook for 2 minutes. Serve this with rice.

name: POPPY SEEDS AND CHANA DAL POWDER
desc: Poppy seeds and chana dal powder is an Andhra recipe used in curries and chutneys which enhance the taste.
instructions:
In a hot pan dry roast the poppy seeds, let it cool down make it into a powder.
Heat ghee in a pan add coriander seeds saute it for a minute then add chana dal and dry red chilies, urad dal, garlic, cloves, tamarind slowly roast it till urad dal and chana dal to brown color.
Let it cool completely add all these ingredients make it into a coarse powder along with poppy seed powder by adding salt.
Serve with hot rice and ghee.

name: TOOR DAL POWDER 1
desc: Toor dal powder is a traditional to the south Indian cuisine and a homemade podi is always more delicious than store bought podi, The toor dal  Podiis often had along with hot steamed rice and ghee
instructions:
Dry roast toor dal in a hot pan until it turns red in color and let it cool down.
Heat oil in a pan add dry red chili, coriander seeds, cumin seeds saute it for a minute then add fenugreek seeds, tamarind, hing, curry leaves. After all, these ingredients are slightly roasted put them in the toor dal plate and let it cool down.
In a blender add all the ingredients make it into a coarse powder by adding salt.Serve this with hot rice along with ghee.

name: POTATO EGG CURRY (KONIR DOM)
desc: Potato Egg curry is a popular south Indian dish, They are very healthy and full of nutrition.
instructions:
Heat mustard oil in a pan add boiled potato pieces saute it for a minute then add boiled eggs fry it till slightly change the outside color, transfer it to a plate and keep it aside.
In the same pan to make curry, in the hot oil add cumin seeds when cumin seeds splutter add green chili, chopped onions, a pinch of salt, cook the onions till it is brown in color.
In this add turmeric powder, ginger garlic paste cooks this till raw flavor is gone, then add tomato chopped, coriander powder, cumin powder, red chili powder, mix it well, cook this for 3 minutes.
Once the tomatoes are cooked add required a quantity of water put the lid on and cook it for a couple of minutes.
Then add boiled and fried eggs and potatoes, garam masala mix it.
Garnish with chopped coriander leavesand serve it with roti, pulka or rice.

name: BUTTERMILK ONION PAKODA CURRY
desc: Pakoras are one of the popular Indian snacks. One of the most popular ones is with onions. These are hot, crispy and spicy. Its a dish where pakoras are made and cooked in tangy sour and spicy yogurt sauce thickened with besan flour.
instructions:
In a bowl add chickpea flour, baking soda, chili powder, pinch of coriander powder, ginger garlic paste, salt mix it and make a thick batter by adding water.
Heat the oil in a pan and drop a spoonful of batter and deep fry till they turn golden brown and crisp.
For tempering heat oil in a pan and add red chili, mustard seeds when mustard seeds splutter add cumin seeds, curry leaves, onion slices, turmeric powder, salt cook this onion, slightly golden color.
In this add pinch of asafoetida, green chili, chopped coriander leaves saute it for 2 minutes then switch off the flame and add butter milk mix it well, in this add pakodas and soak it for some time. Serve with Rice, roti or naan.

name: DRUMSTICK BRINJAL AND MOONG DAL CURRY
desc: A combination of dal and curry in one recipe. It is a spicy and popular gravy prepared in South India.
instructions:
In a pan, heat oil and add sliced onions, salt saute it for 2 minutes.
Then add turmeric powder, ginger garlic paste, drumstick pieces, mix it well.
To it, even add sliced eggplant pieces, put the lid on and let it cook for 5 minutes on slow flame by stirring occasionally.
After 4 minutes, add sliced tomato pieces, green chilies, coriander powder, chili powder, mix it well and cook it with closed lid till the tomatoes are cooked well.
Add soaked moong dal, chopped coriander leaves to the same pan, mix it well and let it cook with closed for 2 minutes. Serve this with Roti, Phulkas or Naans.

name: Home-made Kheema Naans
desc: Keema Naan is popular unleavened flat bread stuffed with flavored minced meat. It is very popular dish in Punjab and other states of India. Keema Naan is one of the delicious foods eaten in the Afghanistan and other Asian subcontinent countries.
instructions:
In a mixing bowl, add sugar, yeast, milk, water and mix together.
Add yogurt to it and mix. Then add little oil, pinch of salt, all-purpose flour and mix to make soft dough (like the pizza dough). Rest this dough for 40 minutes.
In another bowl, add mince meat, chopped onions, garlic, ginger, green chilies, bell peppers, coriander leaves, mint leaves, chili powder, pinch of garam masala, tomatoes, cream, pinch of salt, freshly crushed pepper and combine all ingredients together. Sprinkle some lime juice and mix again.
Sprinkle some flour over the dough and divide them into equal portions.
With help of a rolling pin, roll the dough to a puri size and stretch a bit like a mini naan and keep aside. Give an egg wash over the mini naan.
Spread the mince meat mixture evenly over the naan and sprinkle some grated cheese on the top.
Preheat the Philips Airfryer at 200 degree centigrade for 3 minutes.
Open the basket and place the naans inside. Drizzle little oil over the naan and air fry for 5-6 minutes at 180 degree centigrade until done.
Remove and serve hot.

name: KATHIRIKKAI CHOP
desc: This south Indian brinjal curry is very famous Chettinad specialty.
instructions:
Heat oil in a pan add fennel seeds, crush garlic, curry leaves, chopped onions, turmeric powder, salt cook this for few minutes.
Take out brinjal pieces from water add it to the pan, saute it for few minutes then add red chili powder mix it and put the lid on, reduce the flame and cook this till the brinjal pieces soft.
Add crushed pepper, roasted chana dal mix it well.
Garnish with chopped coriander and serve this with curd rice.

name: CAULIFLOWER PICKLE
desc: Cauliflower Pickle is a delicious pickle from punjab, made with mustard oil and vinegar.
instructions:
In a bowl add small cauliflower florets, salt, red chili powder, fenugreek seed powder and lemon juice mix it well.
For the tempering: Heat oil in a small pan add mustard seeds when they splutter add chana dal, cumin seeds, red chilies, saute it and let it cool down then pour this tempering on the top of the cauliflower pickle. You can bottle it in a clean dry jar. Serve this with Curd rice or rotis.

name: Mac & Cheese Nuggets
desc: A classic macaroni and cheese snack that is made simply with grated cheese, milk, flour, macaroni, mushroom, infused with some garlicky and parsley flavors which are all combined together made into quick-fix balls and air fried until slightly golden in color and crisp on the exterior side. This has a fantastic cheesy and creamy texture inside with the goodness of some gooey cheese that kids would love to relish.
instructions:
Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Salt water and cook macaroni to al dente.
To make a bonde roux: Take a pan, and add butter. When the butter melts, add flour and cook well till the raw flavors of the flour is gone and forms a soft paste.
Add finely chopped garlic, chopped mushrooms, parsley, milk and cook until it becomes a thick consistency.
Add al dente macaroni, pepper, salt and combine all together well.
Switch off the flame, add grated cheese and mix well.
Add 1 tablespoon bread crumbs if the mixture is too tight or moist.
Drizzle some nutmeg powder and mix.
Allow the mixture to cool down and take some amount of the mixture and shape them into roundels and keep aside. 
Drop the dumplings in beaten egg and coat well and then toss them with the bread crumbs. Preheat the Philips air fryer at 180 degrees C for 3 minutes.
Open the basket and place the dumplings inside. Fry the dumplings at 180 degrees C for 4 minutes.
After 4 minutes, pull out the basket, brush over with little oil and re-fry for another 4 minutes.Remove and serve hot.

name: SARSON WALI BHINDI
desc: Mustard flavored okra goes very well with rice and rotis.
instructions:
Heat the pan and add Mustard oil, once the oil is hot add potato, bendi, salt and fry it for 5 minutes on a medium flame. Then transfer it to a plate.
In the same oil add chopped garlic, ginger and saute it and add onion pieces, green chili and turmeric powder cook it for some time.
For mixture: Take a bowl and add Cumin powder, Coriander powder, pepper powder, Chilli powder, Mustard powder and a pinch of sugar, mix it and make into a paste.
And pour this mixture into a pan and mix it well. Then add fried potato and Bendi coated the mixture into it, then put the lid on and cook it for 2 minutes.
Add some salt, squeeze some lemon juice and add chopped Coriander leaves toss it well.Serve this with Curd Rice.

name: PANEER THANDAI
desc: A popular recipe in India prepared as a gravy based curry with the richness of paneer cubes cooked in it.
instructions:
Heat oil in a pan, add shahi jeera, chopped onions, salt, bay leaf cook till onions slightly change the color.
Then add ginger garlic paste saute it for 2 minutes then add poppy seeds and saute it for few minutes.
In a bowl add cardamom powder, almond powder, fennel seed powder, crush pepper , kasuri methi, saffron water, milk, coriander powder mix it well.
Pour this mixture into the pan and mix it, once it comes to boil, add paneer pieces, pinch of sugar cook this for 2 minutes then switch off the flame and serve it.

name: JEERA AND CHILLI PICKLE
desc: Rustic chutney from western part of india.
instructions:
In a pan heat oil and add jeera, red chili saute it in a slow flame, then add soaked tamarind mix it well then switch off the flame and let it cool down and this mixture into the blender and also add jaggery, salt make it into a paste.
In a bowl add jeera and chilli pickle in this add chopped onions, chopped green chillies.Serve this with curd rice and any snack items.

name: FATTA FAT CHUTNEY - RAW PAPAYA CHUTNEY
desc: Chutney made from raw papaya in south Indian style is one of the most had recipes.
instructions:
Peel Papaya and grate it thin. Take a blender and add Ginger garlic pieces, cumin seeds, and green chillies to make a fine paste.
Add this paste along with papaya and also add chili powder, lemon juice, salt, onions, coriander, tomato pieces, tamarind chutney (sweet chutney), sugar, vinegar and mix it well.
Also, add crushed roasted peanuts powder and just mix it.Serve this with Rotis, bread, and papads.

name: GARLIC EGG PICKLE
desc: This is a very interesting and tasty pickle made out of roasted garlic red chilies and whites of boiled egg.
instructions:
Heat oil in a pan, add garlic cloves cook the garlic till it is golden in color. Switch off the flame.
In this, add turmeric powder, coriander leaves, chili powder, coriander powder, lemon juice, salt, mix it.
In a bowl add boiled egg white pieces, pour this garlic mixture and mix it well.
For the tempering : Heat oil in a pan add mustard seeds, when they are splutter add cumin seeds, chana dal, red chilies, urad dal, saute it till the dals  slightly change the color.
Then add asafoetida to the same pan, switch off the flame and add curry leaves. 
At last, transfer this tempering to the above pickle and mix well.Serve this with any kind of snacks.

name: FATTA FAT CHUTNEY - EGGPLANT AND KASOORI METHI CHUTNEY
desc: Aubergine and kasoori methi combination goes very well with most of the rustic indian breads.
instructions: 1. Heat oil in a pan and add coriander seeds, saute it and add red chilli, garlic, eggplant pieces, tomato pieces, green chilli, kasoori methi, salt and mix it and put the lid on and let it cook till the eggplant and tomatoes are tender. 2. When eggplant is cooked switch off the flame and let it cool down. 3. Transfer this in a blender and make a coarse paste. 4. Serve this with Rice or Naan, also with Roti and phulka.

name: BEANS PUTTU
desc: Combination of French beans and dal is very unique and goes very well with diet conscious people.
instructions:
First, soak the chana dal for 3 hours.
In a blender add soaked chana dal, fennel seeds make it into a coarse paste.
In a pan heat oil add mustard seeds when they splutter add cumin seeds, urad dal, curry leaves and prepared a chana dal coarse paste, saute it and add turmeric powder, hing saute it till the dals are slightly change the color.
Add chopped onions, chopped beans, salt, chili powder mix it well and cook it for 3 minutes.
Add garam masala and switch off the flame.Serve this with rice or rotis.

name: CAPSICUM CHANNA DAL SUBZI
desc: Combination of Bell pepper and chana dal which is best eaten with rice and chapatis.
instructions: 1. Heat oil in a pan add bay leaf, cloves, cardamom, shahi jeera, ginger garlic paste. 2.  when ginger garlic paste slightly cooked add chopped green chiily, pinch of turmeric, chana dal (soaked in water for 3 hours) coriander powder, chilli powder, salt to taste add required water mix it and put the lid on and let it cook for 5 minutes. 3. When dal cooked add capsicum, onion, tomato pieces and chopped coriander mix it once and cover it, cook this for 5 minutes. 4.  After 5 minutes squeeze lemon juice. 5.  serve hot with rice or roti.

name: FATTA FAT CHUTNEY -RAW ONION AND JAGGERY
desc: Onion chutney is a great accompaniment to wada,idli, dosa, upma and even appams.  It is very common in all South Indian homes. this chutney even as a spread for a sandwich it tastes very good.
instructions:
Heat oil In a pan, add red chilies, tamarind, onions, hing, salt, and tomatoes, cook it
Now onions are cooked then add cashew nuts, cook it for 1 minute.
Then add jaggery, mix it and switch off the flame, let its cool down, transfer into a mixie jar, to make a paste.serve it with dosa or idli.

name: FATTA FAT CHUTNEY - PEANUT AND GARLIC POWDER
desc: Peanut Chutney Powder recipe is a perfect blend of roasted peanuts, garlic cloves, and chilies. This peanut chutney powder recipecan be served as an accompaniment along with breads, parathas, dosas or even steamed rice with ghee.
instructions:
Heat a pan and add coriander seeds, cumin seeds dry roast it and add red chilies.
Saute it for 2 minutes then add sesame seeds, garlic, peanuts, roast all the ingredients together.
Switch off the flame and transfer it to a plate. By adding salt let it cool down.
Transfer all the ingredients in the blender and make a coarse powder.Serve this powder with idli, dosa, vada or plain rice with peanut powder and ghee.

name: CHOW CHOW CHANNA DAL PORIYAL
desc: This a nice combination recipe with chow chow(chayote) and Bengal gram topped with coconut.
instructions:
In a blender add ginger, fresh coconut and green chilli blend it like a coarse paste.
Heat a pan add oil when oil is hot add mustard seeds.when mustard seeds splutter then add red chillies, cumin seeds, urad dal, curry leaves, a pinch of hing and chow chow vegetable pieces, salt mix it and cook this with the lid on.
In this add prepared coconut and green chilli paste and also add chana dal (soaked and boiled) mix it well and cook it for 5 minutes with the lid on.Serve with rotis.

name: Oatmeal Muffins
desc: Oatmeal combined together with flour, butter, sugar, eggs and flavored with vanilla essence gives a wonderful taste to the muffins. These intensely air fried oatmeal muffins are a great snack that can be eaten anytime guilt-free. They also have a pleasant sweetness from the raisins infused in them.
instructions:
In a mixing bowl, add the butter, sugar and blend well with hand blender until soft.
Add vanilla essence and beaten eggs little by little.
In another bowl add all purpose flour, baking powder, oats, raisins and mix well.
Add the flour mixture to the butter mixture and mix in cut and fold method.
Line the muffin moulds with paper or foil liners.
Fill each mould with some batter and keep aside.
Preheat the Philips air fryer at 180 degrees C for 3 minutes.
Pull out the tray and place the muffin moulds and air fry for 10 mins at 180 degrees C.Remove, cool and serve.

name: FATTA FAT CHUTNEY -  MIRCHI KA TECHHA
desc: This is a classical chilly preserve where green chilies are sauted and ground to a paste along with cumin seeds. It's a preserve goes very well with bhakaris and rustic rotis.
instructions:
Heat oil in a pan add a lot of green chilies and put the lid on and let it cook for 3 to 4 minutes.
Then add rock salt, garlic, cumin seeds then saute it for 2 minutes after that transfer it into the pestle and make a coarse paste.Serve this Mirchi ka techha with Jowar ki roti or plain rice with ghee.

name: CHILLI GARLIC CLUSTER BEANS
desc: This humble poor man's food tossed with chili and garlic is a simple vegetable preparation goes very well with pulkas and rotis.
instructions:
Chop the cluster beans small pieces and keep the chopped cluster beans in hot water by adding salt put the lid on and let it cook till it is soft.
Put the green chili, garlic cloves, cumin seeds in a blender and make it into a coarse paste.
Heat oil in a pan add chopped onions, salt when onions lightly cooked add turmeric and prepared chili garlic paste, saute it for few minute then add coriander powder mix it well and cook for some time.
In this squeeze some lime juice and add chopped coriander leaves.serve this with chapatti and pulka.

name: Easy Chicken Curry With Onion Tomato Gravy 1
desc: Easy Chicken Curry with Onion Tomato Gravy is a way for the Indian food made convenient.
instructions:
Preparation of Tomato onion gravy:Heat oil in a pressure cooker, add chopped onion, salt (to taste), saute it onions are slightly changed.
Then add ginger garlic paste, chopped tomatoes, turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, and cook it for about 10-15 minutes with closed lid.
now, this gravy can be stored in air tight containers and put it in refrigerator for further uses.Preparation of Chicken curry with Tomato onion gravy:Heat a pan, add 1 cup of onion tomato gravy, 1 teaspoon of cashew nut and poppy seed paste along with some water and mix it well.
Add chicken pieces to the above pan and let it cook with closed lid for 15 minutes, after that check the seasoning.
To it, add garam masala powder, mint leaves, coriander leaves, mix this and serve this hot.

name: FATTA FAT CHUTNEY - INDIAN PICKLE CHUTNEY
desc: This simple Indian pickle chutney with combination of curd and onions. It's a raita kind pickle based with yogurt.
instructions: In a bowl, add one tablespoon of mango pickle, chopped onions, one small cup of yogurt and mix it well.  Serve this with upma or pongal.

name: Hara pakoda
desc: Thotakura balls prepared with Thotakura/ Amaranth leaves/ Chauli are much-loved greens used for preparing stir fries, dal and stew in our daily meal.
instructions:
In a bowl add amaranth leaves, asafoetida, chili powder, sesame seeds, ginger garlic paste, chopped green chilies, salt, mix it.
Then add chickpea flour, mix it well and rest it for 3 minutes moisture will be ooze out.
Make them into small dumplings and deep fry all the dumplings in hot oil over medium heat.Serve this hot.

name: KADHAI FRIED PULAV
desc: This comfort food made with lots of vegetables and plain cooked rice, generally the left over rice can be used to make a lip snacking kadhai fried pulav.
instructions:
Heat the kadhai very hot, in this add onions, green chili, green peas and add butter, turmeric powder, salt to taste saute it for few minutes.
Add juliennes of spinach, small pieces of potatoes, chopped tomatoes, red chili powder, garam masala, mint leaves, chopped coriander leaves and mix it well.
Then move the sauteed mixture on edges. Later add 1 cube of butter, spring onions, squeeze lemon juice.
At last, add cooked rice on top, mix this well.Serve this with raitha.

name: CUCUMBER CAPSICUM FRY
desc: This is Kura combination of sweet cucumbers(dosakaya) and capsicum cooked in south Indian style can be served with rice or rotis.
instructions:
Dry roast the sesame seeds and peanut in a pan and make a fine powder.
Heat oil in a pan add big pieces of onions, salt, saute it for 5 minutes.
After 5 minutes add yellow cucumber pieces, turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, cumin powder saute it for a minute.
Then add desiccated coconut powder, capsicum pieces, tomatoes, green chili mix it once.
Add sesame seeds, peanut powder cook this for 3 minutes with a lid on.Serve this with rice or chapatti.

name: Brinjal Rasam 1
desc: This unique south Indian rasam is flavored with brinjals. It has mild seety flavors of brinjal.
instructions:
Heat a pan add peppercorns, red chilies, coriander seeds, chana dal, toor dal, cumin seeds, dry roast all the ingredients and put them into the blender and make a powder.
heat water in a pan in this add brinjal pieces, Chopped tomatoes, turmeric powder, salt, tamarind juice, green chilies, put the lid on and let it cook till brinjal is soft.
Add Dal water, add prepared Rasam powder, once it comes to boil.
heat a pan on another side and add oil, when oil is hot add mustard seeds, hing, curry leaves, switch off the flame and pour the tempering on the top of the rasam and add chopped coriander leaves and put the lid on.

name: COASTAL EGG PULAO
desc: Coastal egg pulav is a special egg pulav where boiled eggs are fried and served along with a flavorful pulav rice. Its a must try for a tasty coastal country side pulav.
instructions:
In a hot pan dry roast cloves, cardamom, cinnamon along with shahi jeera and poppy seeds. Let it cool down put all these ingredients in a blender and make a powder, to this add coconut pieces, green chili makes it into a paste. 
Heat 1tablespoon ghee in a pan add boiled eggs, salt, chopped coriander fry it for 2 minutes.
In a big pan add ghee, once the ghee is a hot put bay leaf, Marathi moggu, peppercorns saute it.
Then add cashew nuts, slices of onions, salt cook this till onions slightly golden color, add curry leaves, mint leaves, ginger garlic paste saute it and add prepared masala and poppy seed paste mix it once.
Add water (when we take 2 cups of rice we need 3 ½ cups water) adjust the seasoning, when water comes to boil add soaked rice.
Once it comes to boil mix it once then put the lid on and cooks for some time. All moisture is evaporated mix it and cook this in a slow flame with lid on.
After 2 minutes switch off the flame and add fried eggs mix it slowly and rest it for 5 minutes.Serve this with raita.

name: Steamed Masala Vada2
desc: Masala Vada is a popular tea time snack. Everyone loves masala vada but we are all concerned about the amount of oil in this delicious snack.

name: DESI POTATO KURMA
desc: Quick Potato Curry, With a simple tomato base and common spices and served with poori, roti or rice.
instructions:
Heat ghee in a pan add whole garam masala, chana dal when chana dal is slightly colored
Add freshly grated coconut saute it for 2 minutes, let it cool down make it into a fine paste.
Heat oil in a pan add cashew nuts saute it for 2 minutes then add chopped onions, salt cook this few minutes then add a pinch of turmeric powder, ginger garlic paste, when ginger garlic paste raw flavor is gone add tomatoes, chili powder add very little water cook this with the lid on.
Once tomatoes cooked add prepared chana dal paste, green chilies, add some water and beaten curd mix it.
once it comes to boil add boiled potato piece cook this for 5 minutes, switch off the flame and let it rest for 2 minutes.Garnish with chopped coriander and serve with chapati or naan, roti.

name: Sukha Murg Ka Mukul1
desc: Tasty Sukha Murg ka Mukul is a brilliant crispy fried snack dish made with threads of chicken breast coated with flour and deep-fried until golden in color and crispy; sprinkled and tossed with some aromatic and flavourful spices to make the dish alluring. This is one of the best snacks that each of us will surely vouch to be eaten at any given time.
instructions:
